instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3332: What is 820-3332? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U5701: What is U5701? this is the keyboard controller chip that takes the keyboard and trackpad input and turns it into a USB device signal for the machine to process. If replacing a keyboard doesn’t fix an issue with keys not typing, check all traces between keyboard connector and this IC. This chip has programming so it must be replaced from a similar, ideally identical board. .
definitions.U7501: What is U7501? This chip is often responsible for creating PP3V3_S5,  PP3V3_S3,  PP3V3_S0,  PP5V_S5,  PP5V_S4,  PP5V_S0.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no kbrd/ tpad
threads.message:
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>. No visible issues. 
Internal keybord and trackpad not responsive and not recognized in system info - tested with 2 known good. External works. 
SMC reset/ power button works (know this is different).

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no kbrd/ tpad
threads.message: Did you try another trackpad cable too?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no kbrd/ tpad
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 43146"]Did you try another trackpad cable too?[/QUOTE]

Yes. Swapped in two complete cases to be sure. 
Noticed <RESISTOR>R5704</RESISTOR> has 3.3v on pin 2 but only 2.8v on pin 1. On a known good board I’m getting 3.3v on both sides. 
If all the caps after <RESISTOR>R5704</RESISTOR> and before <CHIP>U5701</CHIP> are good then does that point to <CHIP>U5701</CHIP> or is something else known to pull PSOC down?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no kbrd/ tpad
threads.message:
"Noticed <RESISTOR>R5704</RESISTOR> has 3.3v on pin 2 but only 2.8v on pin 1"
That is a good reason for bad <CHIP>U5701</CHIP>; change it now.
Apart of <CAPACITOR>C5701</CAPACITOR>/06, the other caps are less probably to fail.
Be sure <RESISTOR>R5704</RESISTOR> has correct value.

Please, do NOT quote an entire post from few cm above...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no kbrd/ tpad
threads.message: <CHIP>U7501</CHIP> replaced and all is good. Solved - thanks.
